text: I don't know about you but I never get
tired of eating corn on the cob but once
in a while you just want to do something
a little bit different with your summer
corn right so today I'm making a really
delicious really really fast tortilla
soup usually it takes hours today 15
minutes tops I'm cutting up my onion
right now I have one medium onion mince
it make it nice and small because you
want it to cook quickly then mince 2
cloves of garlic that's your aromatic
base for your tortilla soup plus some
chipotle chilies of course all right
ready to cook to saute the onions and
garlic heat a tablespoon of oil in a
saucepan a medium saucepan I like to add
my onions first if you add the onions to
the hot pan first then it protects the
garlic from burning which I am very very
for you want to cook these until they're
translucent that should take maybe 5
minutes while the onions saute I'm gonna
ABP and get my corn tortilla strips
ready always be prepared I feel like
it's been a while since I said that I
have 4 corn tortillas here I'm gonna
just cut them into thin strips and make
a little toasty tortilla strips and then
just put them on a baking sheet spread
them out and drizzle them with a little
bit of oil and then they go in a 450
degree oven just until they're crisp and
light golden about 5 minutes now that
the onions and garlic have softened and
are nice and translucent add a
tablespoon of chopped chipotle in adobo
remove the seeds if you don't like it
really spicy stir that around just coat
the onions a little bit and then add 7
cups of chicken broth if you want this
to come to a boil more quickly you can
heat your broth ahead of time but you
have to heat it either way right you
want to bring the broth to a boil with
the onions in Chipotle in there and you
need to get some corn ready so you might
as well take advantage of that time and
cut up your corn now 3 ears cut the
kernels off of 3 ears of corn that would
result in about at least three cups
maybe even four cups of corn depending
on
size of your ears you want to contain
your kernels a little bit you can stick
the tip of the corncob in the hole of my
pen and the kernels will just fall into
the pan I am NOT doing that right now
but it is something that contains the
kernels corns done I'm gonna garnish my
soup with a little bit of picked

pit cut it inside its skin into dice and
then just set it aside I think that the

here could splatter just want to cook

shouldn't take more than a minute
too-hoo the spots getting very full
living life on the edge give it a stir
one minute it's already changed color
and gotten a little bit brighter so I'm
gonna add my shrimp a pound of shrimp
and you just want to cook the shrimp
until they're opaque and that can take
one minute maybe two or three minutes
but keep checking you don't want to
overcook them peeled and deveined tails
on or off that's your choice we like the
way that they look and we like to be
able to pick them up so we leave them on
but they're not edible as soon as the
shrimp are cooked you're gonna want to
taste your broth and see if you need

that you added already has salt in it
and shrimp can be a little bit salty too
even though it hasn't even come back to
a boil I know that it's done and I don't
want to overcook my shrimp so I'm gonna
serve myself
nice big ladle of super spicy corn and
shrimp tortilla soup it's a nice change

little fresh cilantro to finish off it's
